intro: Tabernaemontana veracrucensis, commonly known as the Mexican star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. The flowers bloom in spring and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance.
